H0.text: Chemical remediation is a chemical process used to treat water by destroying a contaminant.

H1.text: Basic remediation is a chemical process used to treat water by destroying a contaminant.

H2.text: Toxic remediation is a chemical process used to treat water by destroying a contaminant.

H3.text: Carbon remediation is the chemical process used to treat water by destroying a contaminant.

A4.text: Disinfection for killing bacteria, viruses and other pathogens, using chlorine, ozone and ultra-violet light.

A5.text: A 2021 study found that a large-scale water chlorination program in urban areas of Mexico massively reduced childhood diarrheal disease mortality rates.
